issue.title: Fixes and design changes
issue.body:
* Fixes "Enable OnePager" that wasn't working (#116)
* Fixes the detection of a "OnePager" template (#116)
* Sidebar width changed to 300px (23% before)
* Fixes the FontAwesome dependency to use 4.7, not the new 5.0 (which was breaking the icon picker)
* WP 4.5 compatibility
* Added .woff2 font files

issue.title: Enable OnePager Not Working
issue.body:
Hi,

When I click Enable OnePager on the Page editor, the page saves/publishes itself but other than that nothing happens. Am I doing something wrong?

I'm using WP 4.4.2 on WAMP at the moment.

Thanks,
Paolo.

issue.title: Fixes and design changes
issue.body:
* Fixes "Enable OnePager" that wasn't working (#116)
* Fixes the detection of a "OnePager" template (#116)
* Sidebar width changed to 300px (23% before)
* Fixes the FontAwesome dependency to use 4.7, not the new 5.0 (which was breaking the icon picker)
* WP 4.5 compatibility
* Added .woff2 font files

issue.title: Use home_url() instead of $_SERVER to get the host name in get_current_page_url()
issue.body:
I saw the following error when starting up the editor.

```
Fatal error: Uncaught RuntimeException: Invalid host label, check its content in 
/var/www/html/wp-content/plugins/tx-onepager/vendor/league/url/src/Components/Host.php:164
```
It means that the verification of the host name failed.

ref:
https://github.com/themexpert/onepager/blob/develop/src/functions.php#L73-L79

Depending on web server configuration, $_SERVER ['SERVER_NAME'] may return the following values:
	
```
*.example.com
```

In this case, the editor will not start and an error will be output.

I suggest using `home_url()` instead of `$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME']` to get the current page URL in `get_current_page_url()`.

Thanks.
